input: Bob is kind. Bob is rough. Bob is young. Charlie is kind. Charlie is rough. Erin is cold. Erin is kind. Erin is smart. Gary is rough. Gary is smart. All rough, big things are cold. All young things are furry. If something is smart then it is young. If Bob is cold and Bob is kind then Bob is furry. If Erin is smart then Erin is cold. If something is rough and kind then it is big. If Charlie is smart and Charlie is furry then Charlie is young. If Charlie is cold then Charlie is smart. All furry, big things are young. Question: Charlie is furry.?
output:
universe u

constant obj : Type u

constant Bob : obj
constant Charlie : obj
constant Erin : obj
constant Gary : obj

constant Kind : obj → Prop
constant Rough : obj → Prop
constant Young : obj → Prop
constant Cold : obj → Prop
constant Smart : obj → Prop
constant Big : obj → Prop
constant Furry : obj → Prop

axiom T1 : Kind Bob
axiom T2 : Rough Bob
axiom T3 : Young Bob
axiom T4 : Kind Charlie
axiom T5 : Rough Charlie
axiom T6 : Cold Erin
axiom T7 : Kind Erin
axiom T8 : Smart Erin
axiom T9 : Rough Gary
axiom T10 : Smart Gary

axiom R1 : ∀ x : obj, Rough x ∧ Big x → Cold x
axiom R2 : ∀ x : obj, Young x → Furry x
axiom R3 : ∀ x : obj, Smart x → Young x
axiom R4 : Cold Bob ∧ Kind Bob → Furry Bob
axiom R5 : Smart Erin → Cold Erin
axiom R6 : ∀ x : obj, Rough x ∧ Kind x → Big x
axiom R7 : Smart Charlie ∧ Furry Charlie → Young Charlie
axiom R8 : Cold Charlie → Smart Charlie
axiom R9 : ∀ x : obj, Furry x ∧ Big x → Young x

theorem charlie_is_furry : Furry Charlie :=
begin
  apply R2,
  apply R3,
  apply R8,
  apply R1 Charlie,
  split,
  exact T5,
  apply R6 Charlie,
  split,
  exact T4,
  exact T5,
end

-- The answer is True
